reviews.review_msg: He emphasizes the topics that he likes but not necessarily what is important. almost every class he says "we dont have time to go over this again, you should look over it yourself online" but yet he goes over some other topic that he enjoys for more than half the class.
No Comments

Horrible Notes. Not Helpful. Yell at people for asking questions and never answer questions adressed to him... these questions veered his whole brain off path of lecture and would spend the rest of the class stuttering like the idiot he is.  His exams we're almost impossible. Homework was fair tho.
By far the worst teacher in the history of teaching.  Notes were pathetic. Got angry when people asked questions. Tests were unrelated to assignments. Stay far away from a class taught by this guy.
No Comments
Just Don't.  Really...I mean it.  Don't.  Real nice guy, but don't.  First midterm: 3 questions, 96 marks.  Don't.  Average 46/96.  I told you don't.  I'm warning you.  Don't.

She is really nice but it was a bit hard to understand her accent at first but you'll get used to it. Goes through the notes too fast, copies straight from her notes to the overhead. Hard to tell the difference between her 2's, a's, e's, 0's, 0', they look all the same.
She's really kind!

I was having trouble understanding the math lecture I had enrolled in so I started going to her lectures instead and all of a sudden math was ten times easier. Her explanations made perfect sense to me. I barely had to use my textbook to understand the course anymore. Lecture notes related perfectly to assignments and exams. Love her.
Her notes are terrible... Don't bother trying to understand her mumbling. She's really nice just doesn't know how to teach. I went back to my calc 12 notes.

He's a bit reserved, but when he smiles you will realize what a great idea it was to take math with him. Not only is he good looking and a powerlifter (he can deadlift 500lbs!), he is very clear and helpful with all his examples. His exams are fairly straightforward if you do the textbook questions. Take his class!

Midterms are fair. Final is pretty brutal. The lectures are confusing though, I find that I leave very unclear of take-home points and find it quite difficult to do homework from his lectures. YouTube (PatrickJMT/Khan Academy) is the only way to pass this course.

A great prof, Dr. Gray is able to teach math very well, and is despite appearences is a very friendly and funny (if in a sort of awkward way) guy who clearly loves math and loves to teach it as well, I give a glowing recommendation, especially in the Fall Season where he does Prof in a box!
Really hard concepts, but Justin Gray explains them in a very clear and concise manner. Would definitely take a class with him again.

Great prof! After going through high school with teachers that did not know how to teach at all, having gray as a prof made it all the better. If you do the homework from the textbook and skim his notes theres no reason why u shouldn't at least get a B. 1st midterm is easy second just a bit harder. Funny prof in an awkward way. Would def take.

Justin Gray has got to be the most hilariously awkward teacher I have ever met. It is clear that he loves the subject, and wants to share his joy with the class. I thoroughly enjoyed his class. He is always willing to help students as well!Favorite quote: "Having trouble thinking out of the box today?" while wearing a box costume. ENJOY HIS CLASS!!
Fav prof so far, a really nice guy! Lectures are not super interesting but gives you a good idea of the materials. He's patient and explains questions well. Definitely recommand him.

Very nice prof, and gives clear explanations. Midterms and Final are fair and straight-forward IF you do all the textbook assignments. Kind and patient when answering questions. Course doesn't require too much work if you've taken Calc in high school.

Having previously taken calc 12 in high school was a benefit. For most people, this was there first calc course and it was pretty advanced. Attending the workshops were useful as the paper assignments and online work were challenging. Exams were fair, as long as you complete the textbook work you should be fine.
Justin's a great prof!! He's got good notes and does lots of examples that come out on exams. The midterms were pretty easy, the final was harder, but not too bad. And he's hot ;)

Great prof. Explained all the concepts with great details. Good interest in the course. Cares about his students and wants them to do well in the course. Good looking. You will do well as long as you do the assigned textbook ques, weekly homework assignments and the online questions. Midterms & final were just like the assignments. Nothing tricky

Clean and tidy presentation. Sometimes a bit confusing, but textbook will save you. 2 Midterms, which are very fair (notes and homework helps a lot). 1 Mid = 15% overall. It reduces the DAMAGE in case you bomb 1. Final is harder, so study 1 week earlier is a must. Looks boring, but he is funny. Recommend for all 1st year, and YOU~~~
Amazing prof that definitely knew what he was doing, If you keep up with assignments and pay attention in lecture, you won't have much trouble...
Such a great prof! He takes difficult concepts and breaks them down so you can understand them. Also, very good looking. So coming to class isn't a chore!
really easy to understand. easy exams if you did the assigned homework. always willing to help
He likes to engage everyone in the class. Make sure you do all the assignments. most of the questions on his tests are very similar to the assignments questions.

The lectures are clear and at a great pace (sometimes slow). The exams are just like the examples in class and hwk, so you can't do poorly if you attend regularly and do the homework. The final was a bit hard but difficulty was taken into account.

Excellent prof! Made math a better experience for me and he goes over explanations well. His tests are not too hard and not too easy, so study the textbk. His notes are helpful as well and he takes some of his exam questions from previous homework questions or from his notes.

I don't know why these students whine about him. He is the best math teacher ever. Using textbook during the exam IS helpful. Slackers just don't know how to use it. The lecture material is much related to the exams but you can't expect him to cover everything on the textbook. You will definitely need to do some extra reading(homework) from the tex

His lectures build your confidence but are almost completly not related to the assignments. Exams are either easy or hard, he doesnt have a medium. Yes our class had open textbook exams but doesnt help as much as you would think. Be aware though, he is the SFU deadlift champion!!!! (over 500lbs)....in other words, dont fight him

This guy is a pretty good professor. Having taken calculus prior to his class I knew that it was a tough subject, but he teaches it at a slow pace so you get a really good idea of what's going on. The only thing I didn't like about the class was the way the TA's marked the homework and exams. But that's separate from the prof, so prof is good!

This prof isn't too hard.  He gives open book exams but he only does so because he knows that only advanced concepts are tested and the text won't be helpful.  It is quite obvious that he loves teaching this subject, if you manage to find him outside of class he can also be quite helpful.  He loves answering questions in lectures.
plays funny calculus songs, makes you lol

This guy is way too hard to be teaching a first year math course. His midterms are ridiculously tough and the fact that they are openbook doesn't help at all.  The questions in the midterms are way tougher than the ones he works out in lecture and the ones in the textbook. By no means is this class a GPA booster.

Greatest teacher you will ever get at SFU. Amazing and clear notes, mostly easy open book midterms and finals. He answers all questions anyone has and is very friendly. Great way to start the day. TRY TO GET J. GRAY!!!!

Overall, a very clear prof who gives a very fair midterm exam. However, the material that he teaches is very superficial and only covers the basic concepts of calculus, so a lot of extra studying is required for exams.Sometimes, he's one of those "Oops the answer to that example is wrong, but you get the point" professors, so beware!
Very buff math god

Very clear explanations -- great teaching style and pace. Always open to questions. Assignments are not too hard; just don't leave them till the last minute. Midterm is open book, but you won't need to use it if you know the concepts. Overall midterm is fair. This is a great prof and you're lucky if you have him for your first year math courses.
- very good
very clear, and easy to copy down notes
omg he's the best math prof ever! he knows how to teach and how to make us understand the concepts . He maintains a good pace :) Although some of his exams are challenging, it was by far, fun heh.

Justin is, by far, the best math prof I've ever had.  He teaches by giving you examples b/c the notes are in the text and for math, u need to do a lot of problems to successfully learn the material.  His writing could use some work, though.  His exams are quite challenging, but fair.

very good prof, eventhough he's new at it. his notes basically sum up wat the text says, which is great for assignments. his exams r challengin but he scales alot!!! he's also not an eye-sore so it's easier to pay attention in class...for the gals ;)

people who are saying that this prof is not good.  I dunno who..  I like Justin very much.  I like how he goes though things slowly and clearly.  Although the midterms and finals were hard like hell, i still enjoyed this class more than math 155 with VERNER...
try to avoid getting this prof.. notes suck and hes an amateur

Mr Gray is very helpfull. His notes are clear. Goes through the material slowly to make sure that the majority of people do understand it. Many overheads are neatly typed up, although his writing could use a litle improvement. As far as now, I think he is the best math lecturer I've ever had.

Justin is a great Professor. He cares about the well-being of his students in and out of class. He's fair and concise. His exams may be challenging but he always takes the level of difficulty into consideration. I was very happy to make his aquiantance. On the plus side, he's hot. =)

he is very great prof. Honestly, out of all the prof i have, he is the great one. In the lecture, he explains things very clear. His exams are fair and so r the TAs' marking. He is very helpful whenever you need help.
Justin is a very good teacher. He explains everything clearly and precisely. It also helps because he is easy on the eyes. His tests are pretty tough, but fair.

He's GREAT! Other than being hot,he's really helpful & takes time to answer Qs.He marks so fairly(even generously) on tests. He explains clearly and not too fast...basically he just wants everybody to get a decent mark & feel good. AWESOME math prof!

Justin is very friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and funny. He is always available to help students understand the concepts, and explains WHY the exams are tough. I appreciate his scaling of grades. I definitely recommend him as a calculus prof!

I don't know what "Math lab guy" is talking about.  Asking Prof. Gray questions in ACW and at his office is what helped me get thru his exams.  He's clear and he genuinely wants to help u, instead of trying to get u to leave as fast as possible.  Disregard that "lab guy's" comment, it doens't apply.

wow, alot of girls are posting for this eh? I find him to be uiet dull at times and his lectures take way too long, however I took calculus already so what do I know? but he is definetly nice to look at, blue eys!!

HOT HOT HOT.  What a great way to start off the morning at 830am.  He's clear and concise... goes at a slow pace but it's good for us.  You can get away with just reading the text and listening to the lecture tapes. Great grasp on english. Sincere and well mannered. fair exams.

Clear and helpful !!! I like his speed.  I, honestly, would rather have a prof who's clear about everything than a prof who just touches on basics and moves on. I dun understand y ppl are complaining when it's obviously beneficial to us.  Keep up the good good work Justin, ur doin' great !
Hi is easy RELATIVE to all the other profs who have taught this course.  We have access to past exams and some of them are VERY scary.

He's quite clear on his concepts and he explains them fairly well.  But he copies his examples right out of the text book, so I never see a point in going to his lectures.  His exams are not "difficult" but they are VERY time consuming.  But he scales, so it's all good. :)

I must admit he is pretty hot for a teacher but his tests are pretty tough though fair. The qestions on midterms weren't hard, but what makes the test tough is that there are just too many questions for that time period. For students that took Calc 12, this course will be quite an easy one.

he is so sllllloowww at teaching this course, the time doesnt seem to move at all... very boring in class...and midterm was HARD, and he's review for the MT wasnt helpful at all, he made it seem easy but it WASNT!!

His midterm wasn't too hard, but it was that the questions were time consuming.   Just because people think he's hot doesn't mean he's gonna make an easy exam.  People that took high school calculus will find the course easier than others.

very hot!he must work out at least 3 hours a day!exams are quite hard.most likely, if you 've never taken calculus before,then you're gonna have trouble,he can't teach!one doesn't have the right to say his test are easy unless they got perfect!
Hot, nice, and helpful; but his exams are NOT fun!!! Want a good mark ? STAY AWAY !!!
he's so hot except his exams arent
No Comments
TOTALLY HOT !!! Need I say more ? But anyway, he's not so bad at teachin, but he is s ... O ... SLOW and s ... o ... BORING ... good thing no names, or else he mite fail me. hehe

He was one of our TA's..sorta. hahaha unless we just went to him cuz he was there:S  He explained things well, but I don't know how his exams are...looking at the above comments, I'm glad I don't.  Not like my prof's were any better though.
I would not take a class with him again.
super nice and his exams were fairly simple and basic.
As Murphy's law states; if things are bad right now, they can always go worse. Taking math with this guy would drop my GPA so I withdrew from his class. And you should, too.

Goes over contents at a very fast pace. He speaks in a heavy accent as if understanding calculus was not hard enough. He really is mediocre at best. I do not recommend him as your first calc class prof.

Speaks in a very heavy accent that makes things much more difficult. Generally hard to read what he's writing because a) he has bad printing and b) he never darkens the room when using the projector. If you are sensitive to high pitched voices I do not recommend taking this class with tuncer.

Alamgir Hossain is a great professor. All of his midterms were very fair, everything that was tested was taught in lecture. It's possible to do very well in his class if you put in the effort. I would take calc with him again. Notes are also proper and if he feels like the class does not understand a certain concept, he will go over it again.
He has a strong ability in the math field. He helps me with MathXL in Open Lab. His Quizzes and Midterm are fair and it's not hard to do well in this course if you put time in.

Alamgir Hossain is jokes. Teaches well too. I think for first year students, Alamgir is a good teacher to learn calc for first time. Highly recommend. He sometimes does confuse you, but midterms are easy, and if you keep up with the work. Your gonna be fine.

This prof managed to confuse me on concepts I already knew (I took Calc 12). Would not recommend it, but in case you have to have him - good luck. Midterms weren't that hard, his lectures were just brutal to sit through.
Very thorough notes. You don't need to show up to class because he uploads all the notes onto Canvas. If you don't understand a concept, he will review it in more depth.

I honestly thought he was a great prof. He is very clear about concepts and his notes are really good. He gives a lot of examples making things easier to understand. Most questions on exams were similar to examples done in class.

u think u know calculus? well, u don't in his class. His class is not for math but more like bio. 80% are explanation and definition and 20% are examples. Not to mention u have to write down everything! for his notes. His tests are really hard. When I mean hard, like the little explanation that he mentioned like 2 minutes in class is 10~20marks./60

Alex is an awesome guy. Very generous with his office hour times and always willing to make himself available outside it if asked. As any math course, it's homework heavy with lots of practice to do but Alex understands calc is hard he tries to explain things as simple as possible. And he will try to explain things from different angles if need be.
Nothing to say other than a really good prof. He is very reasonable with everything, and his exams are a very fair level of difficulty

First three midterms were easy. Final everyone failed, he put stuff he never talked about in class on it. He ended up scaling that exam. He scribbles a lot on his notes and it leaves most of the class confused as we couldn't read what he wrote. I would say just watch the final. (He might change the exam as it was his first year teaching.

Take his class! Great prof

Lectures are all online, grading scheme and exams are clear, easy to approach if you have q's about the course, and his occasional dry humour was funny

The only difficulty comes from the contents of the course itself and sometimes disorganized notes so make your own+rewatch lecs if it happens
After his lectures, watch the recordings and you will do amazing in his class, he's god sent literally made math enjoyable!
BEST PROFESSOR EVERRRR HE IS HIM AND HE IS THE GOAATTTTT!

For his first class of this size, Dr. Beams was pretty good. All lectures were recorded and annotated. The class itself was tough and covered a lot of content, but it helped that we had one cheat sheet for the three midterms. Dr. Beams was also funny, and I enjoyed going to class. The only really big con is that it's at 8:30 in the morning.

Professor Beams is one of the best professors that I ever had. He explains things thoroughly, is very caring and is always available during office hours if you need help. The exams for his class were pretty fair and there were definitely a lot of free marks during his class (iClicker, homework, etc). He's the GOAT.
The nicest prof I have ever had.  Clearly cares about his students and very accessible outside of class.  Tests were very fair, based on exactly what he goes over in lecture.
The best prof ever.
The best prof ever

10/10 prof, caring and supportive. Midterms and Final prep.are really helpful. His tests are fair, If you study, you'll do just fine. Highly recommend first years to take Math 154 with him. This why he is the goat. THE GOAT.
made math fun and such a great lecturer, I recommend him! take class with him
Compared to other profs he is by far the most fair and caring. The only difficulty will be from the course content itself. He is a great lecturer.
GOATEDDDD PROF, by far one of the best experiences in a math class. Such a great prof, totally take class with him !!!
Lectures are a bit hard to follow in class but very nice and so far tests are fair

It's only his first year as a prof and yet he's done much better than all these other profs i've had. He posts recorded lectures right after class, explains concepts very well, and tests are very fair and won't be hard as long as you study and do the homework (as with any math class). Lots of free marks. Take class with him, no regrets.

He really needs to take the time to slow down in lectures and stop scribbling all over the screen, keeping up with him is close to impossible while trying to understand the lecture. Other than his messy notes he's a great prof.

Dr. Beams is the best prof at SFU and all profs must learn to go by similar guidelines to his. Lectures are recorded live and posted immediately on canvas. Exams are based just on lectures but a bit more complex to be appropriate for an exam. Lots of free marks: Iclickers, webassign etc. so ace those. Don't miss out on taking a class with him!
nice and caring
W prof if u taking 154 make sure it him
I swear I have to gone to his office hours and he explains everything in simple terms making sure you understand. Bro made math a fun and exciting class

Calculus is difficult but he makes it very easy to ask for help. Go to his lectures, do your hw and give studying 1 hour a day and you're good. He is very easy to reach and replies to emails on time and his office hours really help. He tries his best every class and it shows by his class attendance even though lectures are recorded

If you have to take MATH, do it with Alex. He teaches clearly, has easy to follow lectures and makes sure you understand the matter. He is the kindest and very understanding. All the possible exam questions  are covered in class so you will be very ready when finals come around. He also has a very subtle sense of humor which makes class so fun!

Alex is by far the best MATH prof. He reads his slides before class and comes prepared (some profs dont). He takes the time to explain topics until you have understood,-no doing it on your own. He always works through questions that will come in the exam. Nothing he does not teach is on the exam. If you have to take MATH 154 take it with Alex.

I can tell he cares for his students because he tries to explain each concept, but that lead us to constantly be behind in lectures. Exams were fair as long as you did the WA and IQ questions. I would say taking calc in high school definitely helped as most of the course was very similar.
Good Professor rounds the grades

not an amazing professor. he seems like a nice guy but very scattered and disorganized. we were behind almost immediately and it affected our midterms. the material itself isnt hard (coming from someone who used to hate math), but he doesnt teach well at all. professor leonard on youtube got me through this class. iclicker questions count as well:(

As someone who had never taken Calc in highschool this class was extremely difficult for me. Would post all assignments the day they are due. Did not answer a single one of my emails all year. Questions on the test were nothing like WA or IQ homework questions. Going to lectures were pointless. Very hard exam. Do not recommend.

The material itself is relatively easy it's exactly like highschool calculus. However he is very disorganized and we would fall behind and he'd do nothing to catch us up. He would ramble and mumble during lectures and was terrible at explaining stuff I taught myself everything. Exams are fair though.

Honestly if you didnt take calc in highschool, you're pretty screwed. if you did you should have no problems with the course as his exams are not particularly difficult. There is just a lot of homework which can be overwhelming at times. But overall, the class is not hard

He's behaving very well. All the midterms were easy, but the final was so hard that I won't ever take another course with this professor. There were tough questions, and we haven't even solved them. It was the worst final of my life.

Ralf had fair midterms, and his assignments gave lots of opportunities to boost your grade. I found him to be a good lecturer towards the start, but towards the end he became disorganized. Be prepared for him to post assignments last minute before the deadline. However, all in all he still was a solid professor!
Our first midterm average was 65% he said it was too high and told us he'd make the other exams harder to drop the average.

Shows up late every lecture, lots of homework, cannot teach a single part of a lesson without going off on a side tangent on something completely unrelated. Which is just confusing and makes lectures almost obsolete because it's impossible to follow.

This is the most boring human on the face of the Earth. He takes forever to teach the class, and thus we ended up at least 2 lectures behind on the material. Instead of cutting material from the final and giving us the scheduled "review" lectures, he taught new material to the very last class. Homework galore as well. Avoid him if possible.

He's okay, his tests aren't extremely unreasonable but he was barely accessible outside of class, he responds to emails like after 7 days. His teaching style sucks, mumbles and stumbles over his words a lot, he's constantly dealing with tech issues and runs late to class. Would be immensely harder without prior calc 12 experience
Was late to a lot of classes (8:30AM lecture) and constantly had tech issues, which led to him rushing over material and not making a lot of sense. Go to the calculus workshop if you want to do well

Took Math 154 as someone that is not a huge fan of math, can definitively say this class was a waste of time, unnecessarily difficult assignments, prof was often late to lectures and very disorganized. Students had to buy extra resources just to be able to do homework. Teaches way behind schedule and tests material that had not yet been taught.

Professor Wittenberg has the potential to be an outstanding lecturer. He is consistently right on time (or late) but a bit unorganized. His grading was fair and nothing we were graded on was too difficult. Taking calc 12 in high school helped immensely and I'd give that a lot of credit as to how I did well in this class.

Poor ralfy was always late to every lecture, he never responds to emails and often assigns homework before teaching the materials. Most of the course with this guy you're gonna have to rely on yourself to prep for the exams

The prof is incredibly disorganized, both in his ability to present information in lectures, and how he rarely follows the planned schedule. in his office hour/calc workshop, its difficult to understand him as he tends to babble on without going straight to the point. I struggled a lot and just self studied cuz I don't understand his lectures.
Test where random
Ralf is a chill prof. He resolved few grading problems in my favor. Didn't make his class hard

He is often late and a bit disorganized, but he tries his best and genuinely cares. His in class explanations can be confusing, but if you go to his office hours he is good at explaining. His exams are fair most of the exam questions come from the homework. All written homework answers are in the filled lecture slides if you look

Not the best prof especially for first year students (even tho he seems like a good guy). He's slow and veryyy behind on things. The midterms and final exam were not the best as the profs behind so literally had no idea what to expect. Try to take this course with a different professor.

Midterms were hard. Always behind schedule. He teaches vert slow and jumps between concepts and doesn't really explain properly. You can understand what he's saying, but once he starts mumbling you will not be able to tell what he's saying at all. One online and written hw due every week. If you didn't take calc before, it's gonna be hard.
hes always behind, cant understand his lectures well due to his lack of organization

Very sporadic jumping form topic to topic without explaining much. Always 5-10 minutes late to class and then spends another 10 minutes talking about random stuff that doesn't matter. If you took calculus in high school you may be ok but if you didn't good luck because he cant teach at all. Avoid him if you can.

He spent a lot of time in the beginning of the semester on review of highschool topics and went into depth with it. But when it we started the calculus portion he would jump from topic to topic and not really go into the depth he had for grade 12 material. He kind of assumes everyone already knows how to do it. AVOID HIM!!!

Rambles constantly. Midterms were difficult, and there were even questions about the homework that hadn't even been covered yet. Constantly behind schedule, and he would teach material the day before the midterm. THere is homework due the week before and of the final.
.
Bad teaching style, almost always late, takes forever to setup,
He jumps between concepts constantly and never explains the steps to get some where.

Prof forces you to buy the textbook and an application for homework, then barely uses the textbook or the application. Instead he gives a copious amount of homework on an online website (the code for which was in the textbook, and that's all you need it for) every week in addition to written assignments. His lectures are slow and uninformative too.

He takes long detours during his lessons, often taking up to a fifth of the class before starting the lesson. He teaches incredibly slowly, often being multiple lessons behind. Unless you took Calculus in High School, this class may be hard for you, not because the content is difficult, but because the professor does not teach the content on time.

Ralf is usually late to class (unfortunately typical for math professors), but otherwise his only real downside is his lack of control over the 400 person class. He is accessible, very nice, and accommodating to students. He falls behind with material but adjusts what is on the exams accordingly. The exams are predictable and quite fair.

He's always late. We're always behind on material, usually by 2-3 lectures. For some reason, we have programming/coding assignments that he doesn't teach. He teaches the class as if we've already taken uni calc courses before, and expects us to perform like we've taken one too. Midterms are heavily assignment-based and extremely long.

He is consistenly late to class and behind on the lectures. He stopped doing review classes to catch up on material the day before tests. His lectures are hard to follow as he tends to mumble and sometimes can't get his point across. He somewhat got it together for the last two weeks, which makes me wish he had done it sonner.

Ralf is a wonderful guy and good at explaining when you get him one-on-one, but he really struggles to be consise in lectures. In 154 we are always behind on the content and have had multiple assessments on material we did not cover until after the due dates.  

I think he would benifit from reducing the reviews at the beginning of 50 min lectures!
He made it very hard for someone who had never been taught the subjects before
if you have taken calculus in high school you can push through and get the grade you desire but this is a horrible introduction to calculus for first-timers.

Is always behind on lectures, & he usually doesn't adjust assignments accordingly. He's always late, and doesn't respond to emails. You can see that he knows his stuff, but he does not know how to teach an introductory course. He teaches as if we also have 20 years of experience and treats this as 'review' when we haven't seen the material before.
He is always late for lectures and never finishes lecture material. We are always behind, and he makes unfinishable midterms.

He's deviated from the syllabus and created extra course materials to solidify concepts, plans to catch up from now until the end of the course. He will change due dates if it become unmanageable, and does go over things well in class. Only issue: he is often late to class and forgets to post his notes or hand in boxes for assignments after class.

he talks so much, always late to lectures, and we were always behind schedule. this was horrible because doing the homework became incredibly hard since he hadn't taught it so you had to teach yourself at that point. his midterms are NOT at all do-able in the 50 minutes given.
He is always late to class, very unorganized, always behind on lectures, forgets to post homework assignments on canvas on time, and gives very confusing lectures.
He is always late and never gets to the point of the class. Our class was so behind and he had to cram everything in time for the finals.

Rushed lectures due to overexplanation of experiments instead of mathematical applications; skipped lots of curriculum topics as a direct result. Didn't excuse midterm during TA strike despite the Surrey class doing so. Notes are quite messy & hard to understand if you miss a lecture. Ralf seems like a nice guy, he just needs to get it together.

Truly a sweet prof who wants you to do well. I am not the strongest in calculus but I did well in this course because Justin is very clear with the material and took the time to thoroughly explain concepts. Take this course with him, you won't regret it.
Super nice guy. Not the best at explaining calculus, but certainly not close to the worst either.

Justin is a super kind guy and his lectures were pretty good, he spent a lot of time answering questions which made him rush some other content. The first midterm was pretty easy and the average was high, but on the second one not enough time was given, the final was difficult so be prepared to study a lot. Overall, would recommend!
spends too much time answering questions, could've spent more time explaining how to solve more important concepts.
Awesome guy. Very patient and answers email questions pretty quickly. Provides lots of practice problems and solutions, so studying is pretty simple.

Justin is okay. He spent a lot of time answering questions, and then rushed through the majority of our course. I think if I hadn't taken AP Calc I wouldve REALLY struggled. He's incredibly kind, but all over the place. Overall, though, I would recommend him! He is relatively patient and available outside of class to answer questions.
Good prof but bad at explaining. Very sweet but expects you to solve complex problems as if prior knowledge is present. Midterms were not given adequate time to complete but the final was better

Added an extra question to the final at 1am the day of..... midterms were not given adequate time for the number of questions, although he does go over ALL questions a student asks, he does, however, fall behind schedule, causing you to have to learn a lot of material on your own. He is a nice prof, and intentive, but be cautious

tries to answer questions, but is kind of confusing/unclear. skips over contents but expects a lot from students. today is the day of the finals and rn is 1am, but just sent an email saying that one added one more question to the finals. lots of stuff on the review package was not taught clearly. is a sweet person but is a very hard prof.
Really good professor, explains everything really clearly. Do a LOT of practice problems and don't hesitate to contact him if you don't get anything

justin was a really good prof and caring. he went above and beyond in his lectures. even provided extra examples just so students can get a better understanding. his tests are fair if you put in the work. this isnt a course where u can slack off in. overall for tests go over review packages, IQ's and CNQ's these saved my grades for both midterms.

Overall a very good prof. He will go over extra examples on the spot to try to ensure everyone understands the concepts. The one problem I have with his class is that he takes too many questions so he has to rush other parts of the curriculum. Only given 40 minutes to complete a pretty long exam so attend his extra review sessions before exams!

Mr. Chan is a good professor with a great attitude, always smiling and clearly passionate about his subject. In my experiences I found him quick to respond to emails even outside of office hours, and he was very fair and clear in instruction and assignments. Lectures are recorded so you do not need to wake up at 8 in the morning to watch them live!

Calc 1 isn't a difficult course, but Dr. Ding makes it too hard to understand. He goes through power points with so much detail in a couple of seconds, without giving the students time to process what was just said. Doesn't check if anyone is listening or gets it. He fell asleep during the final with someone's phone ringing for about 20 minutes.

If u took calc 12, you planned smart. Nice prof, but very confusing! Mumbles a lot in lecture and he assumes you know a lot! When he goes over examples on the board, you don't know how he did it, because it shows a step you know how to do and a solution, missing the work to get there! Use the textbook as exams are from there, and youtube topics!

Has a thick accent, but after a while it gets easier to understand him. I taught myself most of the course material, but lectures were helpful when I needed to ask questions google couldn't answer . If I had trouble with HW I would ask him after class and he was helpful and straight to the point. Easy exams if you do the review material.

First off, the class may be challenging without already have taken Calc 12 but you must understand that you will have to teach yourself everything. Ping has no ability to explain questions, is VERY difficult to even understand, and in the whole semester he failed to show me anything I couldn't learn from the textbook in half the time and effort.
just gotta say i love the guy
He was kinda rude, but he was an OK prof. He was VERY organized. tests were ok, not too easy not too hard. A LOT OF homework.
His class is very straight foward, anything that isn't taught won't be on the exam.

He's not that bad but not that great either. Lectures are not mandatory since he posts notes online but going would be good in my opinion. His notes are straightforward but he's always breathing into the mic. Sometimes its hard to hear what he is saying. The midterms were fair but the final was a lot lot different so you should study hard for that.

alright first of all his grunting and constant moaning already makes me want to leave. on top of the sounds he makes hes always saying uMMM in his lectures making whatever hes teaching confusing :( glad i took APcal

Petr's teaching is very straight forward. His exams are very similar to the assignment questions & lecture examples. If you can understand the concepts and apply them, it's an easy A. Make sure you do & hand in your assignments ON TIME!! He has hearing problems so just shout out any questions. & don't be afraid to go to the ACW for help.
Basically taught myself everything l, you should go to lectures because it is somewhat helpful but I could hardly understand him because of his accent unfortunately

His constant grunting, breathing, and moaning into the mic made me so mad. I didnt know it was possible to be that mad at 8:45am. Rude when you ask him questions. I learned more about the subjects from Khan Academy than I ever did from his lectures, all I ever took away from lectures was anger at his god forsaken mouth noises.
It was very hard to understand what he was saying most of the time because he had a strong accent and would keep breathing into the mic. Overall wasn't too bad but gave us 2 assignments a week.

Lisonek's teaching ability is pretty standard, but the real money is in the class examples he uses in his lecture notes; variations of these examples always manage to find their way onto his exams. Exams are fair if you study, do the homework, come prepared for quizzes. Practice practice practice. Algebra is key.

Petr is pretty boring to listen to. He can be patronizing and socially awkward. But he does cover the material pretty well and his examples mostly make sense. Exams are fair. Theres a lot of material covered in the semester, but its not a hard class if you put the time and effort into the homework every week.

There is a lot to cover in just 3 months, however, prof lisonek does a really nice job explaining the concepts. Weekly quizzes are basically freebies if you do the HW since the Q's are taken straight from there. Midterms, as well as the final exam was fair. As long as you do the HW and know your material, you should be good to go!

The lectures are quite rushed as there is so much material to be covered in this course.  He provides detailed examples and emphasizes on important concepts.  The midterms are fairly straight-forward, if you go over all the examples in the lecture notes and keep up with the weekly homework assignments.  The final exam was a lot tougher.

Dr. Lisonek is a great teacher.  All you need to do to pass his exams and weekly quizzes is to attend class every time, do SOME of the homework, and go over his notes. Try to do your best on the midterms, so that you have less pressure doing the final exam. I really don't understand why people say this is a hard class, because it's not.

1. Notes and examples posted online but you MUST attend class to obtain the answers from those examples 2. He doesn't let you talk and eat in class. He may CATCH you, so I advise you to sit at the back to do this if you MUST 3. Really HARD course overall, especially if you're NOT good in math 4. REVIEW regularly & ask for HELP to SUCCEED!

Midterms were based on in class examples so its useful to go to class. His teaching is not very clear though, I learnt mostly through the examples, textbook, and youtube videos. He is however very helpful during office hours. Do the practice midtermsfinals and textbook questions and you'll be fine.

Petr overcomplicates simple topics and has a very fast-paced teaching style. However, his exams are very straight forward and easy. If you study off his note examples and do textbook questions this class will turn out to be an easy A.

The first midterm is easy and the second one is brutal. The class itself isn't easy especially if you're not good at math. Your mark will reflect your understanding of the material. His tests are fair if you know what you're doing.
He's a good prof... Really funny, even though he's not trying to be. His exams aren't easy, but they are fair.

Petr can come across as gruff, and you better not talk in class, but this guy is great.  Very helpful, very clear, cares about helping his students.  Especially nice with one on one questions.  Class requires lots of work, weekly assignments, but he makes it bearable.  The first math prof I had who provided bio examples in a bio based math class
I really liked him. His notes were good and he was very nice. First midterm was pretty hard, but the second midterm and final were better. I recommend him.

I was scared at first because of all the bad ratings but once you get over his accent, he's actually a good prof. Always helpful, tells you as it is. The midterms are just example questions in class, but beware of the final! WAY harder than the midterms. Ace midterms & assignments so you're not depending on the final to pass the course.

Not a bad professor. He always makes sure to go over enough examples that you understand the concepts and is always open to questions. Midterms and the final weren't easy, but were very fair if you know and understand the concepts. Would definitely recommend taking a course with him.

He is a really good prof! I don't know why he has so much hate. He describes things very well and his midterms are easy. The final of course is a bit more work. I ended up with a B+ in this class so I do recommend taking math with him.
Took this class for the second time, first midterm was hard, second was super easy, final was fair, you need to know the basics of everything.

awesome prof. i'm bad at math and stuggled with this course and failed with another prof. she made things super clear and easy to understand. lessons were well related to homework, and homework was well related to exams. i ended up getting a B. take calc with her if you can!
Extremely helpful. Always available when she said she would be. Lectures were fun, which is something considering what the material is. Wish everyone was as good.
An amazing prof! She was really nice and helpful, and gave us a lot of example questions as well. Hope she teaches Math 155 next year!

Nancy was with out a doubt the best math prof/teacher I've ever had. I wouldn't really say that I'm a math person, and have struggled with it in the past, but she makes everything so easy to understand and presents how to solve problems in a logical way. She also hand writes her notes which I find super useful.

Nancy is very passionate about what she does. She provides a lot of support to her students. It is important to show her that you care and that you're trying and she'll be ready to help you out. Make sure to study her notes.

This was an easy course. Just make sure you read and understand the notes she posts and do the practice final/midterms she hands out. Everything she tests are covered in her lecture. Her final and midterms didn't have any over-the-top stereotypical bullsh*t questions so its all good.

For a science major, I've never been a very strong math student and after high school I put off taking calculus for two years. Nancy's patience and revision of concepts we needed to know to understand the material helped me feel more confident and I left the course feeling like I learned a lot, regardless of my low letter grade

Will only help you if you put in the effort, which is understandable with most profs, but many other students needed a lot of extra help. The only reason why I did fairly well in this class was because it was not my first time taking this class.

Helpful after class and through emails. I really feel she wants her students to succeed and do well in the course, and she is invested in helping us. Explains each step thoroughly and communicates the course material well. One of my favorite profs. Great teacher!
He's fully dedicated to student's success. MATH155 is my second course with him and I am not disappointed. Would take him again.

My favorite math prof at SFU hands down! His tests are very straightforward. Attend his review sessions, attend lectures, and submit your hw on time and you'll do great! He gives great examples and is accessible for help outside of class. I'm taking math 155 with him next semester and I'm genuinely excited.

He is an amazing prof, he is tied with another prof (Sam Thiara) as my favourite prof of my whole degree. He is very caring, takes extra time outside of class to make sure students understand the course content, and the tests are very straightforward (exactly what we learn in lecture). Wish I could do all my math classes with him.

nice and gives a lot of great examples in class. i loved the grading structure bc it makes it easy to do well since the mark is split up into lots of stuff. GO TO REVIEW SESSIONS! his review questions were rly similar to questions on midterms and final. had to figure it out a bit in the start but was rly open to feedback! genuine and caring prof!
Tests are basically what he covers in the review sessions. DO NOT MISS REVIEW SESSIONS!!!

Super kind & approachable. Willing to devote lots of time outside of class to help us prepare for exams. Was his first sem teaching, and about 1/4 into the course, he asked us for our feedback via a poll, & integrated everybody's feedback into lectures moving forward. Exams were very fair & if you go to class + attend review sessions, they're easy.
Good prof
He was pretty fair with all of his tests and homework, and worked really hard to support his students!

Elisha is an incredibly amiable individual. He has a good teaching style, although on certain occasions we may not manage to cover all the examples in class due to time constraints. But he is always prepared to cover the examples that we might have missed, during his office hours or review classes.
He is a good prof overall. I will recommend him.

Professor Are is a very kind and patient person! The week after the last day of classes, he recorded up to 6 extra hours of tutorial help. He is dedicated to students learning and wants to see us succeed. Sometimes he can take a while to respond to emails, but he is very accessible outside of classes!
Very kind person and his exams are fair and he tries to help all students

Professor Are is an amazing teacher who helped many of us succeed by taking extra time to do review sessions and providing examples to prepare us for our exams. Being someone who is horrendously awful at math I was nervous going into this semester but Elisha taught the course well and I feel more confident in my skills/knowledge moving forward.
My best prof so far. Great teacher. I'm not so good in math and I was still able to follow and understand the material clearly.

DONT take this class with him. The only thing he has going right is that he wants us to do well. His notes are messy, hard to follow, and he cant teach at all. He knows nothing about the online assignments assigned and his review sessions just go over the same examples from the notes. If you're not confident in math, take this with someone else.
He is a very nice, caring guy. He was willing to take time out of his day to prepare us for exams.
Best proff and he was very kind and helpful. Exams are fair

He is super patient and genuinely cares about his students. Outside of scheduled office hours, he's willing to take the time out of his day to host extra hours for those who ask him to re-explain concepts. His exams are extremely fair and he'll constantly hint as to what questions will be asked. You're also allowed a formula sheet for the exams.

Professor Are is very kind, understanding and patient. His review lectures were very similar to the tests so make sure you pay attention during them. the tests were reasonable and any one who says otherwise most likely didn't pay attention. His writing is a bit messy and he makes mistakes sometimes, but overall he was a good prof.

Hes a very nice prof, he clearly cares a lot about his students, and he teaches well. People who are saying bad things about him probably just dont pay attention (its an 8:30 am class so its hard to follow along when you're tired). His handwriting is a bit hard to understand though, and he fills in his slides by hand. But overall he's a good prof.
Professor Are is very patient and helpful. His explanation of difficult concepts are clear and understandable. I find his office meetings and workshops super helpful.
Great person. Pre lecture vidoes can be better. I'm fine with the lecture content and teaching style.

He's a nice guy, but we don't do lectures in class just examples. The mini lecture videos are not super helpful and not a good replacement for a full lecture. I didn't take Calculus in HS so I was expecting to struggle a bit, but no quite this much. He over explains simple concepts and skips over the harder criteria, because he thinks it's easy.

Dr. Are is a kind professor, he tries his best to make sure that his students understand concepts and feel like their concerns are heard. He explains concepts clearly and concisely but his slides are kind of messy. The midterm reviews are helpful and he is usually able to help students outside of lecture as well.

Although he is a nice guy, I would rather drive myself off the mountain than attend 8:30 class 3x a week where we look at 3 slides of chicken scratches. He doesn't explain concepts at all, and has no knowledge of any of the homework (IQ or OA). Frequently canceled office hours, and 'midterm reviews' had nothing to do with the midterms. RUN. FAST.
I enjoy his lectures. Difficult concepts are explained with simple relatable examples.

Math 154 course is tough, especially because of the tricky biological problems. But I think Elisha is putting in a lot of effort both in and out of class to help the students succeed. If you're planning to take this course, be prepared to tackle numerous assignments.
Very accessible and considerate prof. I like his teaching so far.
no. just no.

I don't want to just roast him so know he's a kind person. But his lecture slides are messy, he will skip over questions he feels "we should know already", he's unaware of the online and written assignments. If you haven't taken calc in high school just know you'll have to teach yourself everything and rely on the ta's in ACW.

Elisha seems nice enough but his teaching style is terrible. He acts as if everything should be super easy, yet gets his own answers wrong while explaining how to do them. (I've had to figure them out myself many times already...) Avoid taking Math 154 with him. I hope my few remaining braincells can survive the rest of this semester :)

straight up just a terrible professor.
- He can't teach or explain concepts
- We have to watch a previous profs video prior to coming to class
- Midterm was very unlike hw and confusingly worded
- Says everything is easy so he doesn't bother explaining it
- can't read his writing at all 
- even ppl who have taken hs calc r confused :)
RUN AWAY!
Unable to release grades on time but imposes strict deadlines on students  10/10 would recommend if you are happy with your life and need a reality check

she is a really good prof! one of the best! she really cares about you and her exams questions are similar to lecture,lon capa and assignment questions! she is really sweet!i adore her!however the course needs a lot of hard work doing questions

Easy, cute, funny, sweet, kind, enthusiastic, awesome. Best prof I had this semester. Goes over examples, encourages questions and will always help you out if you need the help. Goes out of her way to help you out. Easy midterms/final. Class was not curved though. I want her for MATH 155. T.T

I wouldn't recommend taking class with this prof. Heavy accent but can get used to it. Makes mistakes almost every lecture and runs out of time while confusing himself and others. Typos on almost all assignments and exams (3 midterms + final). Made questions most failed on exams a bonus marks though. Can tell he cares but also easily annoyed.

His accent is very difficult to understand as well as his handwriting. The midterms were so time limited that many students could not finish all the questions. He made mistakes in the lectures, midterms, and the final exam. Although he doesn't say anything disrespectful, his tone seems like he hates his students. Worst professor at SFU. AVOID!!!!!

Chauve is a funny and thorough professor. His accent is not hard to understand. If you watch your video lectures and take notes during lectures, you'll do very well in the class. Test questions are not hard; they are exactly like his notes and the written assignments. He grades tests tough, so be careful with small errors.

I was expecting to struggle a lot in this class since I didn't take calc in highschool but it didn't have a big impact (although I definitely recommend taking it or at least have a friend who did to help you along the way). The french accent didn't affect his lectures whatsoever in my opinion and the TA's in the ACW were very helpful and patient.

Not sure why he has such a low rating. He had 3midterms and 1final, which might sound like a lot but it was actually pre easy since we only had to focus on certain sections at a time. He does have a lot of homework each week, but I found it rlly helpful, esp since his lectures were unclear most of the time. Overall pre easy esp if u took calc in hs

French accent and interesting cursive, beware. 
Overall a decent prof, confusing at times but you can tell he tried. 
Tough questions on exams were made bonus marks if very little were able to get it right. 
If you do the assignments properly, you'll be fine.

He is ok although he could have given us more practice problems during lecture to help with midterms and exams. The midterms are not that hard, time is the only factor that can affect the score. For the exams, it is pretty similar to the practice final. However, it requires a lot of stuff and knowledge from all lectures combined.

There was a lot of assignments and homework per week which made it a bit tedious to keep up with. Other than that Cedric would try to provide some help to deal with test anxiety and even gave some extra points on some of the midterms due to some typos. Overall, he's not too bad but was a little bit confusing at times.
Very hard to understand what he is explaining most of the time and examples are not great representation of whats on exams.
he can't explain anything for the life of him, his exams are very difficult, he often makes mistakes during lectures and doesn't realize till the very end, HE WILL LOWER YOUR GPA

I quite enjoyed his lectures, they were very helpful and informative. However, there are hard weekly assignments, three difficult midterms which most of the class did not finish, and one slightly harder final. Keep on top of your assignments and study lots. But he is very accessible and helpful outside of class. He has great TAs as well.

3 midterms, 1 final, as well as every week there is an online assignment and a written assignment. Attendance is not technically necessary but there are Iclicker questions so i would recommend going as it affects your grade. Exams are hard, and often mistakes made in the questions on the exams, mistakes in lectures and examples, and assignments.
lectures are so hard to understand, he is NOT good at explaining topics, his exams are really hard, avoid him at all cost, he always makes mistakes during lectures which makes you even more confused

CEDRIC IS GREAT! if you pay attention to the questions in class and watch all the prelectures youll be fine. Hes funny and reasonable, not sure why his score is so bad.. just make sure you pay attention and youll be good :)

Cedric was not very helpful in class. His accent made him very difficult to understand and he would get frustrated with himself fairly frequently during class when he would mess up something. Just use the textbook to study. If possible, AVOID HIM!
keep up with the notes and homework and you'll do fine!

i didnt take Calc 12 but did really well in this class. Its easy if you read every question on the assignment and make sure you understand it. He made the hard questions on the midterms and exam bonus which was great and totally bumps up your grade.
If you didn't take Calc 12, it will be HARD. Do as many or all the questions from the textbook... It will definitely help you throughout the course.

The class is impossibly difficult.  So many people keep saying it will be hard if you didn't take Calc 12.  That isn't true, it will be impossible.  If Calc 12 makes such a difference the prof should require that as a pre-req not Pre-Calc 12.  Hard to understand.  All exams and quizzes are obscure and hard to follow.

Yes first year calculus may be hard (especially if you did not take Calculus 12). This is so for this course, as well as all calculus courses. Yes he has an accent. This is so for this professor, as well as many other professors you will encounter in your university career.  He's not super engaging, but he's lighthearted and loves math.

Hardest class ever. If you're a first year, don't take this course with Cedric Chauve. His accent is extremely hard to understand, and so are his notes. Just avoid this prof, you'll thank yourself later.
Difficult to understand, makes mistakes often. Workshop is useless. AVOID if possible.
he goes very fast through his notes and always has mistakes in his lecture notes, easy to get used to his accent, but did not explain anything at all, midterms were fair, final exam was hard

Fortunately, his accent wasn't that hard to get used to, but he doesn't explain anything well in lectures at all.  He confuses himself sometimes and gets corrected by students, at least, one lecture a week.  Easy course if you took (and did well in) high school calculus, but if not you're on your own and will have to teach yourself everything.

Has a really thick accent and his writing can be hard to understand at times. Goes through the lesson very quickly & does not explain the concepts very well so make sure to read the textbook or learn the material online. The weekly quizzes are straight from the homework. midterms are fair but you'll have to understand all the concepts VERY well
It is hard to understand what he is saying and simply you would understand a thing in his lectures. WORST CLASS EVER!!!

Hard to understand in lecture and found it difficult to decipher his questions in weekly assignments. Terrible at explanations and teaching. I ended up teaching myself everything using khan academy and the textbook. Definitely avoid him if you can!!!

If you take Calculus in highschool MATH154  with Cedric is not difficult. As long as you do the homework, and read his notes you will do good. Quizzes and midterms are very fair, everything he asked was from homework, quizzes, or notes.
Worst teacher ever. Avoid avoid avoid.
hard to understand what he's saying most of the time, and he screws up the lecture notes a LOT.  but he will tell you what is on exams
Didn't read his notes once and got 98% on the midterm. not even worth attending lecture, read the textbook and teach yourself if you want to pass
Has a weird way of explaining things, but it makes sense. Getting used to his accent takes some time.

He is a mean and vindictive person.  Will remove even more marks if you ask for a remark.   Can't teach, don't know if he actually knows material, because he's impossible to understand.  Moves crazy fast, can't even write down notes, let alone process info.  Average was a fail.  Don't know why he wants failure for students.
Impossibly difficult.  Workshop and TAs are useless, and midterm is deceptive.

His thick accent makes it nearly impossible to understand what he is saying and even if you do manage to catch a few words, he usually mixes them up. He explains things very poorly and he is just an overall awful teacher. If you have ANY choice at all, don't choose this teacher.
Very confusing...  Midterm asked really obscure questions and wasn't worded correctly.  Prof ended up removing last 4 questions cause all 400 students got it wrong.  Stay away.
Run away.  Sign up for 150, 151, 152, 157 anything else.

Really bad at explaining things.  Examples are totally unrelated to tested question, which is totally unrelated to lecture, which is totally unrelated to text.  He confuses himself during class, loses his train of thought and just rights random numbers.  Very unpleasant.
Kinda tough class
Explains nothing in lectures.. Ended up teaching myself everything
He is terrible, avoid if possible!!!

He has a very harsh accent, and his extremely difficult to understand. I feel that his midterm and final are fair game but you really need to know your material. Over all what are on his exams are what he has covered in class. Make sure you do the practice problems in the textbook as those helped me a lot.
Better to read the textbook than to attend lecture. His examples can be confusing, everything you need to know is in the textbook.
He's probably one of my favourite profs. He's willing to give out extra help during his office hours. His accent just takes time to get use to.

Don't expect to pass if you don't understand French. Weekly assignments, (difficulty came in deciphering the questions).  Midterms were straight from assignments, final was much more challenging. Fair professor, intimidating to talk too. Will ridicule you in class for asking questions.

VERY thick French accent. Sometimes screws up examples. Spend time doing the assigned textbook questions (that don't need to be handed in) and maybe watch some Khan Academy on YouTube OR take calc in high school then you'll do fine
Confusing, just learn from the text.

Avoid if you can especially if you are not strong in math like I am. Makes the simplist concepts confusing, better off learning from textbook, online sites and piratically spending all your time in the math workshops with the TA's.
Very confusing, I only go to lecture to take notes and try to comprehend them afterwards with other resources. Makes multiple mistakes throughout the lecture. Avoid if you can.

There's a few things this prof could improve. Writing's not always clear for notes, french accent can be a problem for some people, sometimes makes mistakes on the notes, and his notes don't explain steps to questions in much detail (uses theories & definitions). The math assignments don't help for exams very much. I recommend textbook questions.

If you know french by any chance this prof is for you! He CANNOT teach, I'm telling you the truth. His french accent combined with constant mistakes make his lectures pointless. He stresses too much on formal definition/theories rather than examples. Also, the examples he uses in lecture are directly from the text book without any proper explanatio
all im going to say is french should be a prerequisite for his courses....no joke! i dont really know if hes  bad at teaching or not  because he is speaking a different language.
Was open to answering questions during class, made note taking engaging, and was thorough in explaining calculus concepts.

Devos is a great prof. He takes time to explain concepts carefully in a way that's understandable. You can tell he's passionate about what he teaches. As long as you attend lectures and follow along and review after class, this course should be okay!

DeVos was a pretty standard teacher in terms of lectures. You show up to class, listen, go home and do your homework assignments. The content of the course is not difficult, IF you study and keep on top of your homework. Personally, I thought DeVos did a great job of explaining material, and he posts lecture notes after class. I highly recommend!

DeVos is very passionate about what he teaches and explains the concepts very clearly. Although I still reviewed after class, he made the material much more clear. There was some delay in answering emails and uploading notes, but it was not too much of an issue. Overall solid prof, I wouldn't mind taking another math class with him.
Really good lectures. Hes pretty slow to upload things and respond to emails, but I really enjoyed how he taught the class.

Devos might be an anxious guy but his lecture examples are very clear and you will see them on tests. Tests were very much like the practice exams he provides. He might not have the best teaching skills but his easy exams make up for it. You will probably have to teach yourself most of the material but it is doable. Class average of B-.
he rambles and really hard to comprehend what he's trying to explain. Work hard you'll do good. But I honestly cant listen to the guy.

He's a bit frazzled during lectures lol. OQ isn't very related to lectures and some IQs are ?? but everything is doable. Go to the workshop for help with hard IQ questions. Everyone there is really helpful. If you understand calc/took it in high school or smth, you should be fine. I found stuff after midterm1 harder but it was an ok class overall
Down to earth prof, very passionate. If you pay attention in lecture and do the review he gives before mid terms and finals, your golden.

Devos is an amazing prof. He's super caring and really explains to the best of his abilities. If you pay attention in class, you're golden. After lecture, you can ask him to explain something and he'll explain till you get it. Midterms and finals are very fair with all the questions coming straight from the slides. Really wish I have him again.

Matt tends to spend an equal amount of time on each chapter which sometimes sucks as certain chapters have more difficult concepts to grasp than others. He's very approachable, but prefers people not to ask questions during lecture as he falls behind quite a bit (explaining trivia questions). His exams are fair/based on examples in notes/IQs

Seems extremely anxious during class, causing him to stutter and be difficult to understand. Skims over content quickly, if you're not paying attention you will fall behind and have no idea whats going on. Outside of class he seems to be a caring professor, the only issue is that he has difficulty communicating effectively.

I think he is one of the best math profs at SFU (no accent & explains concepts clearly). Calc I is easy. If his notes don't make sense, read the textbook for further info and hints for those IQ's. They're not supposed to be easy. Go to the workshop if you need help. It's there for a reason. Calc II is waywayway harder btw.

I have been in this class for 3 weeks and have genuinely no idea what's going on. I put this class off and took it after reading all these decent reviews for Matt. He's constantly disorganized and doesn't seem to know what's going on. The MathXL online questions barely relate to the material and his IQs are incredibly hard and unrelated to lecture.

He rambles about formulas and isn't clear during lectures. If you get math then math 154 is probably going to be alright regardless of what prof you have. His instructor questions are REALLY hard. I love math but the IQ and midterms brought my mark down.

One of the best profs I've ever taken a class with. True that sometimes seemed a little rushed, but ultimately got his material across and he was not responsible for mapleTA malfunctions. Provides great 1 on 1 feedback in workshop. Fairest exams I've ever taken, very similar to notes and assignments. Very understanding and makes lectures engaging.

Despite the hate Matthew got, I thought he was an excellent professor. I always feared math and had been putting this class off for a long time, and I was very happy that I got Matthew as a professor. Some aspects of the course were messy, but Devos made up for it. Exams were very fair.

Extremely unorganized during lectures- something went wrong at least once each class. Seemed frazzled much of the time. Very nice guy outside of class and is a decent 1 on 1 teacher, but he doesn't get his point across well in lecture. Often made many mistakes which he had to correct later on. Learned more off of additional sources than his lecture

this course was a gong show but it wasn't devos's fault. He was very willing to fix problems and accomadate when others involved in the course didn't do their jobs. While his lectures weren't the clearest, but he is great to talk to 1 on 1. He is super patient and thorough during office hours and the midterms were good. his flickr is A+

He is an excellent professor who clearly puts time and effort into teaching his class. He  makes sure you understand the material before moving onto other topics, and unlike most other professors, asks for the students' feedback on their learning experience.

The course itself is not very hard, however, i learned most of the material either by myself or from the internet as his lecture notes were very unclear and had consistent mistakes. He often wasted time in lecture with irrelevant i-clicker questions, and the only online practice we had was not consistent and terrible to use.

Matts speaks clearly and explains concepts well and will keep trying with you until you understand. His tests were very fair and reflective of the materiel. Maple TA was an absolute disaster for most people but in his defence he wasn't responsible for it. His review sheets were also very helpful. I wish he was available more often in the workshop

Honestly for a calc course I feel like he's one of the best you can get. He definitely has his off days; however, his exams were fair and lined up almost perfectly with his notes and review sheets.  MapleTA and the textbook are trash so those two are what made the class the most annoying, both of  which Matt didn't really have anything to do with.

I really enjoyed my experience with Matt and with SFU Math in general. The workshop set up is far superior to having a tutorial. Matt's exams were really fair. Reading the textbook is unnecessary. If you are able to understand the concepts taught in class, you are golden. Just make sure you're great with the quadratic formula (oops).

His midterms and final exam are based on the lectures and what he has actually taught! So getting a good grade is fairly easy, study the notes, and examples and you'll be golden! The marking is fair and the questions are fiar too
He means well :)

Gives little to no relevant practice material, and when asked by class to give more, he removed our online homework program and did nothing else. This professor loves math, but teaches through his own mindset which is unfortunately incompatible with the average student. Makes a ton of algebra mistakes in his lecture notes and shows minimal work.

His lectures aren't very clear in helping you understand. He makes a lot of mistakes in class, which is quite confusing but also hilarious. He has a lot of instructor questions that are just trivia but worth for participation marks. He always seems very rushed getting to class on time and finishing the lecture in time.
He is very passionate, especially when you talk to him in person. Also, when you go to his office hours, he explains an problem that you may have clearly and understandingly.

Great class! He explains the concepts really well, and doesn't express frustration with redundant questions in lectures. The assignments were always harder than his exams, so everyone did really well! He was in the Math lab every week, and the tests were always more than fair. The average was decent for a first-year class.

Great prof! He goes through everything step by step and makes the material very easy to understand. He puts solutions online and if you do all the homework and practice problems before exams you will do great!

Great Prof! He is very clear and explains everything so coherently. He doesn't have a lot in the way of office hours but way they are provided he goes above and beyond to make sure you understand. Tests are very fair mid-term 1 avg: 70%, mid-term 2 avg:69%, final avg: 60.5%.
if you want to get a REALLY good mark for calculus.. take his class. class average for his tests are usually in the 65-70%. great prof!
He actually explains and I'm able to understand what he's talking about. I use to LOVE math until I took it with another proff and failed it. But Devos is really good at his explanations.

she is a really good prof and she is super sweet. most of these negative reviews are coming from whiny first year students that are still getting the hang of university. she was caring and helped if you needed some help. she does make some mistakes but it happens if you are a new prof and if you put in the effort you will do well, so stop slacking.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! She threatened to fail me at the beginning of the semester and did so despite my quizzes coming back with passing grades. Had to change my major halfway through my degree because of the grade given.
She was just confused lol.

I think Dr. Macpherson got so much hate for no reason. She was a caring professor and just wanted her students to succeed! The lectures may have been confusing at times but everyone makes mistakes. I highly would recommend taking math 154 with Dr.macpherson!

I think everyone was too harsh on MacPherson. While her lectures are confusing, her mini-lectures were actually very helpful. I would go to lectures just for the iclicker and do other work during that time. WATCH THE MINI LECTURES. I also found the exams to be very simple and straightforward with no trick questions. Plus she allows cheat sheets

I got an A in that class but no thanks to the prof. she explained simple topics in a confusing manner and I was only able to get a good grade due to taking AP Calc in high school and teaching myself outside of class.
If you do not watch the prelecture videos, you will have no idea what is going on in class. Watch them. They're not that bad. Frequent assignments, do them, they make your 3 midterms a lot easier.

Dr. MacPherson is not a very adapt lecturer. Her explanation of concepts is unnecessarily confusing and too fast paced. Her study guides are very rarely helpful and there's far too much hw. However, if you put in the work to teach yourself she does give you the foundation to start from. She seems nice but just needs to work on her teaching skills.

Somehow I was questioning the things I already learned in high school calculus because of this prof, and I GUARANTEE I would've gotten a lower mark if it weren't for high school. Also, every single lecture she made at least one mistake and that's not an understatement. Avoid this prof if you struggle at math but have to take a math course

Dr. MacPherson is a great person and tries her hardest to accommodate issues that students may have. I found the material to be fairly simple and straightforward although Math and Calc is not an easy subject to learn quickly. To excel in the subject, be prepared to do practice questions, even though it wasn't assigned.

A very intelligent young woman and truly has a passion for math and biology. She's a new prof, she made mistakes here and there and her notes were a bit messy sometimes. But, she knows what she's talking about and has the utmost credentials to teach this course. She was very fair and her online mini-lecs were so helpful! She will improve over time.

Only thing I got from Math 154 was a diagnosis for severe anxiety - no joke. Way too much time and dedication needed for this course. Part 1 of lesson delivered on YouTube, part 2 during scheduled time, 2 online assignments weekly, ACWs for revision and questions, 2hrs of practice dail to study, and no answer key given for any exam study guides.

Not sure why people suddenly have positive things to say about Dr. MacPherson when throughout the semester everyone was complaining about her. Is it because of the huge scale to improve grades and make the class average a B or sudden change in heart? A true mystery if you ask me.

Never learned anything from this class. No answer keys given for study guides because she believes that you don't know what you're doing if you need one. Funny coming from her as she makes constant mistakes during her lectures.

I spoke to Dr. MacPherson multiple times throughout the semester about struggling in this class. She never did anything to encourage or help me. Instead, she suggested I drop out to "save her time with marking".

Worst professor I've had in the last 2 years. Get ready to teach yourself because she doesn't know what she's doing. Constantly makes careless mistakes & assigns complicated homework assignments. Exams are unnecessarily long & challenging, making them impossible to complete. Study guides don't have answer keys either. Save your time and tuition.

She'll call you out in front of the class if you're being disrespectful and occasionally threaten to call on random people. Attendance is mandatory (iClicker) and you'll need to buy the whole textbook just for assignments. The exams are reasonable and reflect the lectures but the 2 weekly assignments are quite difficult and time-consuming.

Overall Dr. MP is a great person + she cares for her students. But her lectures, exams, study guides are all riddled with uncorrected errors. This makes reviewing much harder than it needs to be. Overall her midterms are fair, and marking is fair. But be prepared to do some extra learning on your own if her lectures don't help. UNDERSTAND JUPYTER!
She wasn't that bad. Lectures were unclear, however her pre lecture videos were actually pretty helpful. All the tests were somewhat fair except for midterm 2.
