While she's kind+passonate abt math, Prof's mistakes made in both prelecture vids+during lectures made some topics hard to grasp. Didnt go to office hours but khan academy+doing the homework helped lots. Txtbk needed for online hw access, cheat sheets allowed for exams (which are fair+mainly word problems), inclass polls + weekly hw

I got an A+ in this course, no thanks to Dr. Macpherson. She makes countless, careless mistakes every lecture that interfere with comprehension. Unhelpful and says she doesn't have time to help when you need something beyond what TAs can do for you. Two assignments per week even on exam weeks, three midterms and a final. Wouldn't recommend

Math 154 was very frustrating. Between multiple errors embedded in lecture and study content, to study guides having no solutions to understand if your answer is right. That being said, Dr. MacPherson was the most helpful during office hours. Don't rate your prof based on their personality. She's nice, but there are improvements to be made.

Doctor Macpherson was overall a pretty good prof, keeping in mind that she's fairly new at teaching. She let the students have 2 cheat sheets for midterms and 4 front and back for the final exam! the material itself is pretty light but half the time she has no idea what she's doing and will mess up in every lecture. there's a lot of homework that's way harder than what we learn in class and sometimes you don't learn how to do it until the day it's due. One of the better profs I've had. She made a couple of calculation errors sometimes but it's really not a big deal - overall her lectures were great. In-class lectures tend to be a mess and she doesn't explain/show her steps clearly enough. Errors in everything, lecture notes, study guides, and exams. Exams are incredibly easy. She is a decent prof and tries her best to teach, even though she may not be the best lecturer. Occasionally, she will make errors as we all do. She allows cheat sheets for her exams. The homework load is manageable; however, do expect that a small portion of the homework WILL NOT be covered in the lecture (you might have to learn it on your own).

W professor when she isn't yelling at everyone. She went through some character development and stopped yelling at everyone near the second half of the course. 
The only part of the course that is useless is coding assignments but it's a major part of your grade.

She was nice in the ACW with TAs, cheat sheets for all exams. People cyberbullied her in group chats... ofc, the type who never put in effort when struggling and just complained :/

Professor MacPherson is not as bad as other people say Her lectures are straight forward, she goes fast but usually has time for questions. She's honestly not as bad as others claim. Exams are pretty fair, and lectures are straight forward. She does make some calculation errors but it really isn't the end of the world. I do think the mark you get reflects the work you put in. Overall this is a calculus course so it is not "easy" and will require you to put in the work and study.

She gets too much hate on rate my prof, she's not that bad! It is unfair that you need to buy a textbook (that you'll never use) just so that you can access the assignments. The second midterm was extremely unfair, but she listened to everyone's feedback and changed for the third midterm.

Overall not a bad prof, lots of easy marks from iclicker online and written assignments. She seemed to fall apart after the first midterm but after all the criticism from the second and third it became good again. I would take this prof again.

this prof overcomplicates simple problems and makes way too many mistakes during lectures so you don't know if you are doing the right thing from what you learned in lectures

Dr. Macpherson is a nice person. She makes mistakes during her lectures so make sure to double check q's and not rely on her lectures. Nice person but terrible prof. Makes tons of mistakes during her lectures which makes it extremely confusing to follow along. Also, constantly rambles during lectures so notes arent done most of the time. Would recommend to friend only if the course was online.
